subject: Re: Pluggable Selector considered harmful? (Re: [junit] Re: Observations from a production use of JUnit4)
msgSnippet: ... That s true, but it s still something to be mindful of. And to be more specific, what is slow in reflection is look up, not invocation, so if you really
messageBody:
On 2/2/06, Stephen Smith <steve@...> wrote:
>
> I don't think the performance overhead associated with reflection is as
> much of an issue as it was in early versions of Java


That's true, but it's still something to be mindful of.

And to be more specific, what is slow in reflection is look up, not
invocation, so if you really need to use it, make sure you minimize the
number of times you need to look up a method name.

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
